versos: (dogs) "Do not give dogs what is sacred; do not throw your pearls to pigs. If you do, they may trample them under their feet, and turn and tear you to pieces." - Matthew 7:6 NIV;;;
(tear) Mark 15:38 - "The curtain of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom.";;;
(depart) Matthew 7:23 - "And then will I profess unto them, I never knew you: depart from me, ye that work iniquity.";;;

(coast) Deuteronomy 1:7 - "Turn and take your journey, and go to the hill country of the Amorites and to all their neighbors in the Arabah, in the hill country and in the lowland and in the Negeb and by the coast, the land of the Canaanites, and Lebanon, as far as the great river, the river Euphrates.";;;
(pertain) 1 Timothy 1:4 - "Neither give heed to fables and endless genealogies, which minister questions, rather than godly edifying which is in faith: so do.";;;
(sell) Matthew 19:21 - "Jesus said to him, 'If you want to be perfect, go, sell what you have and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and come, follow Me.'";;;
(pottage) Genesis 25:29 - And Jacob sod pottage: and Esau came from the field
(darkness) "The light shines in the darkness, and the darkness has not overcome it." - John 1:5;;;
(clothing) "Yet I tell you that not even Solomon in all his splendor was dressed like one of these." - Matthew 6:29;;;
(offered) 1 Samuel 13:9 - "So he said, 'Bring me the burnt offering and the peace offerings.' And he offered the burnt offering.";;;
(naked) Genesis 3:10 - He answered, "I heard you in the garden, and I was afraid because I was naked; so I hid.";;;
(remember) Exodus 20:8 - "remember the Sabbath day by keeping it holy.";;;
(advice) Proverbs 12:15 - "The way of a fool is right in his own eyes, but a wise man listens to advice.";;;
(fair) Ezekiel 18:25 - "Yet you say, 'The way of the Lord is not fair.' Hear now, O house of Israel, is it not my way which is fair, and your ways which are not fair";;;

(moabites) Deuteronomy 23:4 - "because they did not come to meet you with bread and water on your way when you came out of Egypt, and because they hired against you Balaam the son of Beor from Pethor of Mesopotamia, to curse you.";;;
(ammon) 2 Samuel 10:1 - "In the course of time, the king of the Ammonites died, and his son Hanun succeeded him as king.";;;
(sober) 1 Peter 5:8 - "Be sober-minded; be watchful. Your adversary the devil prowls around like a roaring lion, seeking someone to devour.";;;
(feel) Psalm 34:18 - "The Lord is close to the brokenhearted and saves those who are crushed in spirit.";;;
